intro: Halenia garcia-barrigae, commonly known as the Garcia-Barriga's halenia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurel trees and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and glossy, elliptical leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
